extendedInfo.description: Add an icon on status bar, shows the current network is 2G or 3G.Click on the notice, can quickly launch "2G Only" setting screen.source code here:http://code.google.com/p/conwood-android-tools/downloads/

reviews.title: Anybody help!! It cause an error
reviews.comment: It said \"Unfortunately, the process com.android.phone has stopped.\" when I run the app. How can I fix it ??
reviews.author: augustini sos

reviews.title: Nice app.
reviews.comment: The icon is shown in the notifications tab. I\'d rather have it in the ongoing apps portion. Other than that, no qualms.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Really does the job
reviews.comment: It boosts my signal right up on my samsung galaxy ace android for the likes of download doesnt cut off as much now. If use are looking for improvements go for a 4g to work for androids.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good job!
reviews.comment: Great app.. now i can manage my data quota!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This app wood be good if you can replace the icon. I don\'t need 2 icons and it\'s 2010 with all the new phones coming out we want 4G icon. 5*if updated
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: It always tell my phone speed =)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Work\'s perfectly, but I would prefer that the info was in ongoing and not at notifications .hope to see an update
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Does what it says and I like the status bar icon... There can\'t be a toggle bc of the way it was designed or something. This is the as good as it gets
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: James Masters
reviews.comment: I`m an Acer A200 user and had wondered if my wi fi tablet could be converted to a 3G, anyway I came across this app and was delighted to find when I sat down on a bench in town and opened my internet browser to find I was instantly connected to the the internet. keep up the GOOD WORK.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: I using its fantasting and fast
reviews.author: alfaj khan

reviews.comment: Had been searching for a nice easy app for switching 3g to 2g... Finally, found it... Thanks...ConWd
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Conserve battery by switching to 2G
reviews.comment: Instead of disabling data to conserve battery just switch to 2G. Simply takes you to phone settings to change. Status bar  doesn\'t work some times on S3. Used to work flawlessly on S2
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: @Person under why a widget then you cant access when on browser or market. This is so useful when you need to access the network menu. Fast and simple
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Notification is pointless. Android already has an icon in the status bar that shows your data speed. 2G-3G OnOff widget by CurveFish is better.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t run at all on my device
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I\'ve been using this for months and it\'s invaluable. Helps save battery making it easy to switch to 2G when you don\'t need 3G. I rely on it! HTC Desir
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Good if you want a persistent status bar icon shortcut. Wish it went in \"Ongoing\" instead of \"Notifications\". Decided i wanted a home screen widget.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: No option for autoboot, it would be bettet if it could show if 2g only is enabled rather than what you\'re on cos 3g is not available everywhere
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Not for CDMA. Showed 3G when I was in 1X only, links to system select window which only offers home only/automatic.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Galaxy S2.
reviews.comment: Indicator shows 2g even when on 3g. Only useful as a shortcut.
reviews.author: A Google User
